context: By 2024, Toast had become a publicly-traded company (IPO in September 2021 at $40/share, opening at $65) and a leading restaurant technology platform serving approximately 134,000 restaurant locations primarily in the US. Toast held 21.72% market share in the POS systems category, competing with 219 tools. The company identified Block/Square (25.56% market share) as its biggest competitor. Toast continued to differentiate through its purpose-built restaurant focus, integrated all-in-one platform covering POS, online ordering, loyalty, and payroll, and 24/7 customer support. The restaurant technology sector saw significant investment and innovation, with multiple companies going public in 2021 including Toast and Olo.

competitors.name: Block (Square)
competitors.notes: Toast's biggest self-identified competitor with 25.56% market share in POS systems. Square for Restaurants offers general-purpose POS solutions that work well for small cafes, food trucks, and quick-service restaurants. Offers free plan with essential features, making it attractive for new businesses. Square competes across both retail and restaurant segments.

competitors.name: Clover
competitors.notes: Major competitor with 6.21% market share. Offers customizable POS experience with wide range of hardware options, third-party apps, and integrations. Accepts more payment options than Toast and provides contract-free flexibility.

competitors.name: Lightspeed
competitors.notes: Restaurant-specific POS system known for powerful back-end features in inventory and multi-location management. Designed for fine dining establishments, franchises, and large restaurant groups. Offers 24/7 support like Toast but at higher price point with steeper learning curve.

competitors.name: TouchBistro
competitors.notes: iPad-based POS focused on restaurant-specific needs. Intuitive, mobile-friendly solution ideal for food trucks, pop-ups, and casual dining. Offers strong offline functionality and is more affordable than Toast, though primarily geared toward iOS users.

competitors.name: Retail Sales Manager
competitors.notes: Second-largest competitor in POS systems category with 13.70% market share, though primarily focused on retail rather than restaurants.

competitors.name: SpotOn
competitors.notes: All-in-one solution combining POS with marketing, loyalty, and reservation tools. Strong choice for full-service restaurants looking to enhance customer engagement.

competitors.name: Olo
competitors.notes: Restaurant technology company focused on digital ordering and delivery. Went public in March 2021. Listed as key competitor in the enterprise food technology market.

competitors.name: NCR Voyix
competitors.notes: Major enterprise restaurant technology and POS provider competing in the large restaurant chain and multi-location segment.

competitors.name: Revel
competitors.notes: Strong POS system designed for restaurants with multiple locations. Competes in the enterprise and multi-unit restaurant space.

competitors.name: Presto
competitors.notes: Restaurant technology company and Toast competitor that went public in late 2021. Operates in the enterprise food technology market.
